block.p: Susanne Ricard-Konig and Daniel Louis Power were married yesterday on the beach in Southampton, N.Y. Mayor Joseph P. Romanosky Jr. of Southampton officiated.

The bride, 33, is the managing director of Ipso Facto Publishers, in New York and Paris, which specializes in photography books. She graduated from the Catholic University of Leuven, in Belgium, and received a master's degree in American studies and art history from the Ruhr-University Bochum, in Germany. She is the daughter of Dr. Marianne Konig and Rolf Konig of Dusseldorf, Germany. The bride's mother is the medical director of the Dusseldorf public health service. Her father is a painter.
Susanne Ricard-Konig and Daniel Louis Power were married yesterday on the beach in Southampton, N.Y. Mayor Joseph P. Romanosky Jr. of Southampton officiated.

The bride, 33, is the managing director of Ipso Facto Publishers, in New York and Paris, which specializes in photography books. She graduated from the Catholic University of Leuven, in Belgium, and received a master's degree in American studies and art history from the Ruhr-University Bochum, in Germany. She is the daughter of Dr. Marianne Konig and Rolf Konig of Dusseldorf, Germany. The bride's mother is the medical director of the Dusseldorf public health service. Her father is a painter.

The bridegroom, 38, is the publisher of PowerHouse Books, a publisher of art and photography books in New York. He is also a co-founder and a former owner of Distributed Art Publishers, an art-book distribution company in New York. He graduated from the University of Iowa. He is a son of Justine and Daniel Power of Des Moines. His mother, who is retired, was a preschool teacher at Greenwood Elementary School in Des Moines. His father is a professor and the director of the Neal and Bea Smith Center for Public Service Attorneys at Drake University Law School in Des Moines.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.
